title: 80,000 Hours AI Safety Guide
oneLiner: Comprehensive career guide covering paths into AI safety work.
whenToSuggest: When they need a broad overview of career options in the field.
whenNotToSuggest: If they're past the overview stage and need specific depth.
firstSmallStep: Read the main AI safety problem profile page (30 min)

title: AI Safety Camp
oneLiner: Research camps bringing together people to work on concrete alignment problems.
whenToSuggest: When they want intensive, collaborative research experience.
whenNotToSuggest: If they need more foundation first or prefer solo work.
firstSmallStep: Browse past project reports to understand camp structure and output quality (30 min)
nextStep: Join the AI Safety Camp community and apply for the next camp

title: AI Safety Fundamentals Course
oneLiner: Structured 8-week intro covering core concepts, risks, and research directions in AI safety.
whenToSuggest: Early exploration when someone wants a systematic foundation before diving deeper.
whenNotToSuggest: If they prefer learning-by-doing or already have strong ML background and want technical depth.
firstSmallStep: Read the curriculum overview and first week materials at aisafetyfundamentals.com/alignment (30 min)
nextStep: Apply for the next cohort or start self-study with the reading list

title: Alignment Forum Deep Dives
oneLiner: Read seminal posts on the Alignment Forum to understand current research debates.
whenToSuggest: When they want to engage with cutting-edge thinking and have some technical background.
whenNotToSuggest: If they need more foundational context first or prefer structured courses.
firstSmallStep: Read "AGI Safety from First Principles" by Richard Ngo (45 min)
nextStep: Pick 3 posts from the recommended reading list and take notes on key disagreements

title: Anthropic Careers
oneLiner: One of the leading AI safety labs, building Claude with safety as a core focus.
whenToSuggest: For experienced researchers/engineers ready to work at a frontier lab.
whenNotToSuggest: If they're early in exploration or don't meet job requirements.
firstSmallStep: Read Anthropic's core views on AI safety and recent research publications (45 min)
nextStep: Identify 1-2 roles that match your skills and prepare application materials

title: ARENA (Alignment Research Engineer Accelerator)
oneLiner: Intensive program building ML engineering skills specifically for alignment work.
whenToSuggest: For engineers wanting to build technical skills specifically for alignment research.
whenNotToSuggest: If they prefer theory over implementation or lack programming experience.
firstSmallStep: Complete the first ARENA exercise notebook to gauge difficulty (1 hour)
nextStep: Work through the prerequisite materials and apply for the next cohort

title: MATS (ML Alignment Theory Scholars)
oneLiner: Intensive research mentorship program pairing scholars with leading alignment researchers.
whenToSuggest: For people with strong ML skills ready to commit full-time to alignment research.
whenNotToSuggest: If they're still exploring or don't have the ML prerequisites.
firstSmallStep: Read the MATS application guide and scholar profiles to understand fit (30 min)
nextStep: Identify 2-3 potential mentors whose work aligns with your interests and draft application

title: Redwood Research
oneLiner: Non-profit research lab focused on applied alignment research.
whenToSuggest: For researchers interested in interpretability and evaluation.
whenNotToSuggest: If they prefer policy or governance work.
firstSmallStep: Read Redwood's research agenda and recent papers (30 min)
nextStep: Explore open positions and reach out to team members

title: Conduct Informational Interviews
oneLiner: Talk to 3-5 people currently working in your target area to understand day-to-day reality.
whenToSuggest: Anytime someone is considering a new field or role type.
whenNotToSuggest: If they've already done extensive networking in this area.
firstSmallStep: Draft 3 questions you'd ask someone in your target role and identify 2 people to contact (30 min)
nextStep: Send outreach messages and schedule your first conversation

title: Resume Positioning Workshop
oneLiner: Reframe your existing experience to highlight transferable skills for your target area.
whenToSuggest: When transitioning between fields and worried about appearing unqualified.
whenNotToSuggest: If already working in the target field.
firstSmallStep: List 5 accomplishments from past roles and identify transferable skills in each (30 min)
nextStep: Rewrite your resume summary to lead with the most relevant transferable experience

title: Side Project Reality Test
oneLiner: Build a small project in your target area to test skills and genuine interest.
whenToSuggest: When someone is unsure if they'll enjoy the day-to-day work.
whenNotToSuggest: If they're already very confident in their interest.
firstSmallStep: Define a 2-week project scope that uses core skills from your target role (30 min)
nextStep: Block 5-10 hours in your calendar and start building

title: Skill Gap Analysis
oneLiner: Compare your current skills to job requirements and identify the most important gaps.
whenToSuggest: When they have a target role in mind but aren't sure if they're qualified.
whenNotToSuggest: If they're still exploring broadly and haven't narrowed down options.
firstSmallStep: Find 3 job postings for your target role and list all required skills (45 min)
nextStep: Rate your proficiency in each skill and identify the 2-3 most critical gaps
